00188 /***************************************************************************/
00209 static void ADC_LoadDevinfoCal(ADC_TypeDef *adc,
00210                                ADC_Ref_TypeDef ref,
00211                                uint32_t calRegShift)
00212 {
00213   uint32_t calReg;
00214   uint32_t newCal;
00215   uint32_t mask;
00216   bool setNewCal = true;
00217 
00218   mask = ~(_ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_MASK
00219 #if defined( _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_MASK )
00220           | _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_MASK
00221 #endif
00222           | _ADC_CAL_SINGLEGAIN_MASK);
00223   mask <<= calRegShift;
00224   calReg = adc->CAL & mask;
00225   newCal = 0;
00226 
00227   switch (ref)
00228   {
00229     case adcRef1V25:
00230       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL0 & DEVINFO_ADC0_GAIN1V25_MASK)
00231                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_GAIN1V25_SHIFT)
00232                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEGAIN_SHIFT;
00233       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL0 & DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSET1V25_MASK)
00234                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSET1V25_SHIFT)
00235                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_SHIFT;
00236 #if defined( _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_MASK )
00237       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL0 & _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL0_NEGSEOFFSET1V25_MASK)
00238                  >> _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL0_NEGSEOFFSET1V25_SHIFT)
00239                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_SHIFT;
00240 #endif
00241       break;
00242 
00243     case adcRef2V5:
00244       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL0 & DEVINFO_ADC0_GAIN2V5_MASK)
00245                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_GAIN2V5_SHIFT)
00246                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEGAIN_SHIFT;
00247       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL0 & DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSET2V5_MASK)
00248                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSET2V5_SHIFT)
00249                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_SHIFT;
00250 #if defined( _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_MASK )
00251       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL0 & _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL0_NEGSEOFFSET2V5_MASK)
00252                  >> _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL0_NEGSEOFFSET2V5_SHIFT)
00253                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_SHIFT;
00254 #endif
00255       break;
00256 
00257     case adcRefVDD:
00258       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & DEVINFO_ADC0_GAINVDD_MASK)
00259                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_GAINVDD_SHIFT)
00260                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEGAIN_SHIFT;
00261       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSETVDD_MASK)
00262                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSETVDD_SHIFT)
00263                  << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_SHIFT;
00264 #if defined( _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_MASK )
00265       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL1_NEGSEOFFSETVDD_MASK)
00266                  >> _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL1_NEGSEOFFSETVDD_SHIFT)
00267                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_SHIFT;
00268 #endif
00269       break;
00270 
00271     case adcRef5VDIFF:
00272       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & DEVINFO_ADC0_GAIN5VDIFF_MASK)
00273                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_GAIN5VDIFF_SHIFT)
00274                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEGAIN_SHIFT;
00275       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSET5VDIFF_MASK)
00276                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSET5VDIFF_SHIFT)
00277                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_SHIFT;
00278 #if defined( _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_MASK )
00279       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL1_NEGSEOFFSET5VDIFF_MASK)
00280                  >> _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL1_NEGSEOFFSET5VDIFF_SHIFT)
00281                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_SHIFT;
00282 #endif
00283       break;
00284 
00285     case adcRef2xVDD:
00286       /* There is no gain calibration for this reference */
00287       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL2 & DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSET2XVDD_MASK)
00288                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSET2XVDD_SHIFT)
00289                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_SHIFT;
00290 #if defined( _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_MASK )
00291       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL2 & _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL2_NEGSEOFFSET2XVDD_MASK)
00292                  >> _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL2_NEGSEOFFSET2XVDD_SHIFT)
00293                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_SHIFT;
00294 #endif
00295       break;
00296 
00297 #if defined( _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_VREFSEL_VDDXWATT )
00298     case adcRefVddxAtt:
00299       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & DEVINFO_ADC0_GAINVDD_MASK)
00300                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_GAINVDD_SHIFT)
00301                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEGAIN_SHIFT;
00302       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSETVDD_MASK)
00303                  >> DEVINFO_ADC0_OFFSETVDD_SHIFT)
00304                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_SHIFT;
00305       newCal |= ((DEVINFO->ADC0CAL1 & _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL1_NEGSEOFFSETVDD_MASK)
00306                  >> _DEVINFO_ADC0CAL1_NEGSEOFFSETVDD_SHIFT)
00307                 << _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSETINV_SHIFT;
00308       break;
00309 #endif
00310 
00311     /* For external references, the calibration must be determined for the
00312        specific application and set by the user. Calibration data is also not
00313        available for the internal references adcRefVBGR, adcRefVEntropy and
00314        adcRefVBGRlow. */
00315     default:
00316       setNewCal = false;
00317       break;
00318   }
00319 
00320   if (setNewCal)
00321   {
00322     adc->CAL = calReg | (newCal << calRegShift);
00323   }
00324 }

00332 /***************************************************************************/
00354 void ADC_Init(ADC_TypeDef *adc, const ADC_Init_TypeDef *init)
00355 {
00356   uint32_t tmp;
00357 
00358   EFM_ASSERT(ADC_REF_VALID(adc));
00359 
00360   /* Make sure conversion is not in progress */
00361   adc->CMD = ADC_CMD_SINGLESTOP | ADC_CMD_SCANSTOP;
00362 
00363   tmp = ((uint32_t)(init->ovsRateSel) << _ADC_CTRL_OVSRSEL_SHIFT)
00364         | (((uint32_t)(init->timebase) << _ADC_CTRL_TIMEBASE_SHIFT)
00365           & _ADC_CTRL_TIMEBASE_MASK)
00366         | (((uint32_t)(init->prescale) << _ADC_CTRL_PRESC_SHIFT)
00367           & _ADC_CTRL_PRESC_MASK)
00368 #if defined ( _ADC_CTRL_LPFMODE_MASK )
00369         | ((uint32_t)(init->lpfMode) << _ADC_CTRL_LPFMODE_SHIFT)
00370 #endif
00371         | ((uint32_t)(init->warmUpMode) << _ADC_CTRL_WARMUPMODE_SHIFT);
00372 
00373   if (init->tailgate)
00374   {
00375     tmp |= ADC_CTRL_TAILGATE;
00376   }
00377   adc->CTRL = tmp;
00378 
00379   /* Set ADC EM2 clock configuration */
00380 #if defined( _ADC_CTRL_ADCCLKMODE_MASK )
00381   BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&ADC0->CTRL,
00382                      _ADC_CTRL_ADCCLKMODE_MASK | _ADC_CTRL_ASYNCCLKEN_MASK,
00383                      init->em2ClockConfig << _ADC_CTRL_ASYNCCLKEN_SHIFT);
00384 #endif
00385 
00386 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
00387   /* Fix for errata ADC_EXXX */
00388   ADC_IntClear(adc, ADC_IFC_SCANUF);
00389 #endif
00390 }

00393 #if defined( _ADC_SCANCHCONF_MASK )
00394 /***************************************************************************/
00401 void ADC_ScanInputClear(ADC_InitScan_TypeDef *scanInit)
00402 {
00403   /* Clear input configuration */
00404 
00405   /* Select none */
00406   scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanInputSel = 0xFFFFFFFF;
00407   scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanInputEn = 0;
00408 
00409   /* Default alternative negative inputs */
00410   scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanNegSel = _ADC_SCANNSEL_RESETVALUE;
00411 }
00412 
00413 
00414 /***************************************************************************/
00436 uint32_t ADC_ScanSingleEndedInputAdd(ADC_InitScan_TypeDef *scanInit,
00437                                      ADC_ScanInputGroup_TypeDef inputGroup,
00438                                      ADC_PosSel_TypeDef singleEndedSel)
00439 {
00440   uint32_t currentSel;
00441   uint32_t newSel;
00442   uint32_t scanId;
00443 
00444   scanInit->diff = false;
00445 
00446   /* Check for unsupported APORTs */
00447   EFM_ASSERT((singleEndedSel <= adcPosSelBUS0YCH0) || (singleEndedSel >= adcPosSelBUS0YCH15));
00448 
00449   /* Decode the input group select by shifting right by 3 */
00450   newSel = singleEndedSel >> 3;
00451 
00452   currentSel = (scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanInputSel >> (inputGroup * 8)) & 0xFF;
00453 
00454   /* If none selected */
00455   if (currentSel == 0xFF)
00456   {
00457     scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanInputSel &= ~(0xFF << (inputGroup * 8));
00458     scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanInputSel |= (newSel << (inputGroup * 8));
00459   }
00460   else if (currentSel == newSel)
00461   {
00462     /* Ok, but do nothing.  */
00463   }
00464   else
00465   {
00466     /* Invalid channel range. A range is already selected for this group. */
00467     EFM_ASSERT(false);
00468   }
00469 
00470   /* Update and return scan input enable mask (SCANMASK) */
00471   scanId = (inputGroup * 8) + (singleEndedSel & 0x7);
00472   EFM_ASSERT(scanId < 32);
00473   scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanInputEn |= 0x1 << scanId;
00474   return scanId;
00475 }
00476 
00477 
00478 /***************************************************************************/
00508 uint32_t ADC_ScanDifferentialInputAdd(ADC_InitScan_TypeDef *scanInit,
00509                                       ADC_ScanInputGroup_TypeDef inputGroup,
00510                                       ADC_PosSel_TypeDef posSel,
00511                                       ADC_ScanNegInput_TypeDef negInput)
00512 {
00513   uint32_t negInputRegMask;
00514   uint32_t negInputRegShift;
00515   uint32_t negInputRegVal;
00516   uint32_t scanId;
00517 
00518   /* Do a single ended init, then update for differential scan. */
00519   scanId = ADC_ScanSingleEndedInputAdd(scanInit, inputGroup, posSel);
00520 
00521   /* Reset to differential mode */
00522   scanInit->diff = true;
00523 
00524   /* Set negative ADC input, unless the default is selected. */
00525   if (negInput != adcScanNegInputDefault)
00526   {
00527     if (scanId == 0)
00528     {
00529       negInputRegMask  = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH0NSEL_MASK;
00530       negInputRegShift = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH0NSEL_SHIFT;
00531       EFM_ASSERT(inputGroup == 0);
00532     }
00533     else if (scanId == 2)
00534     {
00535       negInputRegMask  = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH2NSEL_MASK;
00536       negInputRegShift = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH2NSEL_SHIFT;
00537       EFM_ASSERT(inputGroup == 0);
00538     }
00539     else if (scanId == 4)
00540     {
00541       negInputRegMask  = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH4NSEL_MASK;
00542       negInputRegShift = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH4NSEL_SHIFT;
00543       EFM_ASSERT(inputGroup == 0);
00544     }
00545     else if (scanId == 6)
00546     {
00547       negInputRegMask  = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH6NSEL_MASK;
00548       negInputRegShift = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH6NSEL_SHIFT;
00549       EFM_ASSERT(inputGroup == 0);
00550     }
00551     else if (scanId == 9)
00552     {
00553       negInputRegMask  = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH9NSEL_MASK;
00554       negInputRegShift = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH9NSEL_SHIFT;
00555       EFM_ASSERT(inputGroup == 1);
00556     }
00557     else if (scanId == 11)
00558     {
00559       negInputRegMask  = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH11NSEL_MASK;
00560       negInputRegShift = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH11NSEL_SHIFT;
00561       EFM_ASSERT(inputGroup == 1);
00562     }
00563     else if (scanId == 13)
00564     {
00565       negInputRegMask  = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH13NSEL_MASK;
00566       negInputRegShift = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH13NSEL_SHIFT;
00567       EFM_ASSERT(inputGroup == 1);
00568     }
00569     else if (scanId == 15)
00570     {
00571       negInputRegMask  = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH15NSEL_MASK;
00572       negInputRegShift = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH15NSEL_SHIFT;
00573       EFM_ASSERT(inputGroup == 1);
00574     }
00575     else
00576     {
00577       /* There is not negative input option for this positive input (negInput is posInput + 1). */
00578       EFM_ASSERT(false);
00579     }
00580 
00581     /* Find ADC_SCANNSEL_CHxNSEL value for positive input 0, 2, 4 and 6 */
00582     if (inputGroup == 0)
00583     {
00584       switch (negInput)
00585       {
00586         case adcScanNegInput1:
00587           negInputRegVal = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH0NSEL_CH1;
00588           break;
00589 
00590         case adcScanNegInput3:
00591           negInputRegVal = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH0NSEL_CH3;
00592           break;
00593 
00594         case adcScanNegInput5:
00595           negInputRegVal = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH0NSEL_CH5;
00596           break;
00597 
00598         case adcScanNegInput7:
00599           negInputRegVal = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH0NSEL_CH7;
00600           break;
00601 
00602         default:
00603           /* Invalid selection. Options are input 1, 3, 5 and 7. */
00604           EFM_ASSERT(false);
00605           break;
00606       }
00607     }
00608     else if (inputGroup == 1)
00609     {
00610       /* Find ADC_SCANNSEL_CHxNSEL value for positive input 9, 11, 13 and 15 */
00611       switch (negInput)
00612       {
00613         case adcScanNegInput8:
00614           negInputRegVal = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH9NSEL_CH8;
00615           break;
00616 
00617         case adcScanNegInput10:
00618           negInputRegVal = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH9NSEL_CH10;
00619           break;
00620 
00621         case adcScanNegInput12:
00622           negInputRegVal = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH9NSEL_CH12;
00623           break;
00624 
00625         case adcScanNegInput14:
00626           negInputRegVal = _ADC_SCANNSEL_CH9NSEL_CH14;
00627           break;
00628 
00629         default:
00630           /* Invalid selection. Options are input 8, 10, 12 and 14. */
00631           EFM_ASSERT(false);
00632           break;
00633       }
00634     }
00635     else
00636     {
00637       /* No alternative negative input for input group > 1 */
00638       EFM_ASSERT(false);
00639     }
00640 
00641     /* Update config */
00642     scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanNegSel &= ~negInputRegMask;
00643     scanInit->scanInputConfig.scanNegSel |= negInputRegVal << negInputRegShift;
00644   }
00645   return scanId;
00646 }
00647 #endif
00648 
00649 
00650 /***************************************************************************/
00670 void ADC_InitScan(ADC_TypeDef *adc, const ADC_InitScan_TypeDef *init)
00671 {
00672   uint32_t tmp;
00673 
00674   EFM_ASSERT(ADC_REF_VALID(adc));
00675 
00676   /* Make sure scan sequence is not in progress */
00677   adc->CMD = ADC_CMD_SCANSTOP;
00678 
00679   /* Load calibration data for selected reference */
00680   ADC_LoadDevinfoCal(adc, init->reference, _ADC_CAL_SCANOFFSET_SHIFT);
00681 
00682   tmp = 0
00683 #if defined ( _ADC_SCANCTRL_PRSSEL_MASK )
00684         | (init->prsSel << _ADC_SCANCTRL_PRSSEL_SHIFT)
00685 #endif
00686         | (init->acqTime << _ADC_SCANCTRL_AT_SHIFT)
00687 #if defined ( _ADC_SCANCTRL_INPUTMASK_MASK )
00688         | init->input
00689 #endif
00690         | (init->resolution << _ADC_SCANCTRL_RES_SHIFT);
00691 
00692   if (init->prsEnable)
00693   {
00694     tmp |= ADC_SCANCTRL_PRSEN;
00695   }
00696 
00697   if (init->leftAdjust)
00698   {
00699     tmp |= ADC_SCANCTRL_ADJ_LEFT;
00700   }
00701 
00702 #if defined( _ADC_SCANCTRL_INPUTMASK_MASK )
00703   if (init->diff)
00704 #elif defined( _ADC_SCANCHCONF_MASK )
00705   if (init->diff)
00706 #endif
00707   {
00708     tmp |= ADC_SCANCTRL_DIFF;
00709   }
00710 
00711   if (init->rep)
00712   {
00713 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
00714   /* Scan repeat mode does not work on platform 2 as described in errata  ADC_EXXX. */
00715   EFM_ASSERT(false);
00716 #endif
00717     tmp |= ADC_SCANCTRL_REP;
00718   }
00719 
00720   /* Set scan reference. Check if reference configuraion is extended to SCANCTRLX. */
00721 #if defined ( _ADC_SCANCTRLX_VREFSEL_MASK )
00722   if (init->reference & ADC_CTRLX_VREFSEL_REG)
00723   {
00724     /* Select extension register */
00725     tmp |= ADC_SCANCTRL_REF_CONF;
00726   }
00727   else
00728   {
00729     tmp |= init->reference << _ADC_SCANCTRL_REF_SHIFT;
00730   }
00731 #else
00732   tmp |= init->reference << _ADC_SCANCTRL_REF_SHIFT;
00733 #endif
00734 
00735 #if defined( _ADC_SCANCTRL_INPUTMASK_MASK )
00736   tmp |= init->input;
00737 #endif
00738 
00739   adc->SCANCTRL = tmp;
00740 
00741   /* Update SINGLECTRLX for reference select and PRS select */
00742 #if defined ( _ADC_SCANCTRLX_MASK )
00743   tmp = adc->SCANCTRLX & ~(_ADC_SCANCTRLX_VREFSEL_MASK
00744                          | _ADC_SCANCTRLX_PRSSEL_MASK
00745                          | _ADC_SCANCTRLX_FIFOOFACT_MASK);
00746   if (init->reference & ADC_CTRLX_VREFSEL_REG)
00747   {
00748     tmp |= (init->reference & ~ADC_CTRLX_VREFSEL_REG) << _ADC_SCANCTRLX_VREFSEL_SHIFT;
00749   }
00750 
00751   tmp |= init->prsSel << _ADC_SCANCTRLX_PRSSEL_SHIFT;
00752 
00753   if (init->fifoOverwrite)
00754   {
00755     tmp |= ADC_SCANCTRLX_FIFOOFACT_OVERWRITE;
00756   }
00757 
00758   adc->SCANCTRLX = tmp;
00759 #endif
00760 
00761 #if defined( _ADC_CTRL_SCANDMAWU_MASK )
00762   BUS_RegBitWrite(&adc->CTRL, _ADC_CTRL_SCANDMAWU_SHIFT, init->scanDmaEm2Wu);
00763 #endif
00764 
00765   /* Write scan input configuration */
00766 #if defined( _ADC_SCANCHCONF_MASK )
00767   adc->SCANCHCONF = init->scanInputConfig.scanInputSel;
00768   adc->SCANMASK   = init->scanInputConfig.scanInputEn;
00769   adc->SCANNSEL   = init->scanInputConfig.scanNegSel;
00770 #endif
00771 
00772   /* Assert for any APORT bus conflicts programming errors */
00773 #if defined( _ADC_BUSCONFLICT_MASK )
00774   tmp = adc->BUSREQ;
00775   EFM_ASSERT(!(tmp & adc->BUSCONFLICT));
00776   EFM_ASSERT(!(adc->STATUS & _ADC_STATUS_PROGERR_MASK));
00777 #endif
00778 }
00779 
00780 
00781 /***************************************************************************/
00801 void ADC_InitSingle(ADC_TypeDef *adc, const ADC_InitSingle_TypeDef *init)
00802 {
00803   uint32_t tmp;
00804 
00805   EFM_ASSERT(ADC_REF_VALID(adc));
00806 
00807   /* Make sure single conversion is not in progress */
00808   adc->CMD = ADC_CMD_SINGLESTOP;
00809 
00810   /* Load calibration data for selected reference */
00811   ADC_LoadDevinfoCal(adc, init->reference, _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_SHIFT);
00812 
00813   tmp = 0
00814 #if defined( _ADC_SINGLECTRL_PRSSEL_MASK )
00815         | (init->prsSel << _ADC_SINGLECTRL_PRSSEL_SHIFT)
00816 #endif
00817         | (init->acqTime << _ADC_SINGLECTRL_AT_SHIFT)
00818 #if defined( _ADC_SINGLECTRL_INPUTSEL_MASK )
00819         | (init->input << _ADC_SINGLECTRL_INPUTSEL_SHIFT)
00820 #endif
00821 #if defined( _ADC_SINGLECTRL_POSSEL_MASK )
00822         | (init->posSel << _ADC_SINGLECTRL_POSSEL_SHIFT)
00823 #endif
00824 #if defined( _ADC_SINGLECTRL_NEGSEL_MASK )
00825         | (init->negSel << _ADC_SINGLECTRL_NEGSEL_SHIFT)
00826 #endif
00827         | ((uint32_t)(init->resolution) << _ADC_SINGLECTRL_RES_SHIFT);
00828 
00829   if (init->prsEnable)
00830   {
00831     tmp |= ADC_SINGLECTRL_PRSEN;
00832   }
00833 
00834   if (init->leftAdjust)
00835   {
00836     tmp |= ADC_SINGLECTRL_ADJ_LEFT;
00837   }
00838 
00839   if (init->diff)
00840   {
00841     tmp |= ADC_SINGLECTRL_DIFF;
00842   }
00843 
00844   if (init->rep)
00845   {
00846     tmp |= ADC_SINGLECTRL_REP;
00847   }
00848 
00849   /* Set single reference. Check if reference configuraion is extended to SINGLECTRLX. */
00850 #if defined ( _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_MASK )
00851   if (init->reference & ADC_CTRLX_VREFSEL_REG)
00852   {
00853     /* Select extension register */
00854     tmp |= ADC_SINGLECTRL_REF_CONF;
00855   }
00856   else
00857   {
00858     tmp |= (init->reference << _ADC_SINGLECTRL_REF_SHIFT);
00859   }
00860 #else
00861   tmp |= (init->reference << _ADC_SINGLECTRL_REF_SHIFT);
00862 #endif
00863   adc->SINGLECTRL = tmp;
00864 
00865   /* Update SINGLECTRLX for reference select and PRS select */
00866 #if defined ( _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_VREFSEL_MASK )
00867   tmp = adc->SINGLECTRLX & (_ADC_SINGLECTRLX_VREFSEL_MASK
00868                           | _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_PRSSEL_MASK
00869                           | _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_FIFOOFACT_MASK);
00870   if (init->reference & ADC_CTRLX_VREFSEL_REG)
00871   {
00872     tmp |= ((init->reference & ~ADC_CTRLX_VREFSEL_REG) << _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_VREFSEL_SHIFT);
00873   }
00874 
00875   tmp |= ((init->prsSel << _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_PRSSEL_SHIFT));
00876 
00877   if (init->fifoOverwrite)
00878   {
00879     tmp |= ADC_SINGLECTRLX_FIFOOFACT_OVERWRITE;
00880   }
00881 
00882   adc->SINGLECTRLX = tmp;
00883 #endif
00884 
00885   /* Set DMA availability in EM2 */
00886 #if defined( _ADC_CTRL_SINGLEDMAWU_MASK )
00887   BUS_RegBitWrite(&ADC0->CTRL, _ADC_CTRL_SINGLEDMAWU_SHIFT, init->singleDmaEm2Wu);
00888 #endif
00889 
00890   /* Assert for any APORT bus conflicts programming errors */
00891 #if defined( _ADC_BUSCONFLICT_MASK )
00892   tmp = adc->BUSREQ;
00893   EFM_ASSERT(!(tmp & adc->BUSCONFLICT));
00894   EFM_ASSERT(!(adc->STATUS & _ADC_STATUS_PROGERR_MASK));
00895 #endif
00896 }
00897 
00898 
00899 #if defined( _ADC_SCANDATAX_MASK )
00900 /***************************************************************************/
00917 uint32_t ADC_DataIdScanGet(ADC_TypeDef *adc, uint32_t *scanId)
00918 {
00919   uint32_t scanData;
00920 
00921   /* Pop data FIFO with scan ID */
00922   scanData = adc->SCANDATAX;
00923   *scanId = (scanData & _ADC_SCANDATAX_SCANDATASRC_MASK) >> _ADC_SCANDATAX_SCANDATASRC_SHIFT;
00924   return (scanData & _ADC_SCANDATAX_DATA_MASK) >> _ADC_SCANDATAX_DATA_SHIFT;
00925 }
00926 #endif
00927 
00928 
00929 /***************************************************************************/
00946 uint8_t ADC_PrescaleCalc(uint32_t adcFreq, uint32_t hfperFreq)
00947 {
00948   uint32_t ret;
00949 
00950   /* Make sure selected ADC clock is within valid range */
00951   if (adcFreq > ADC_MAX_CLOCK)
00952   {
00953     adcFreq = ADC_MAX_CLOCK;
00954   }
00955   else if (adcFreq < ADC_MIN_CLOCK)
00956   {
00957     adcFreq = ADC_MIN_CLOCK;
00958   }
00959 
00960   /* Use current HFPER frequency? */
00961   if (!hfperFreq)
00962   {
00963     hfperFreq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_HFPER);
00964   }
00965 
00966   ret = (hfperFreq + adcFreq - 1) / adcFreq;
00967   if (ret)
00968   {
00969     ret--;
00970   }
00971 
00972   return (uint8_t)ret;
00973 }
00974 
00975 
00976 /***************************************************************************/
00987 void ADC_Reset(ADC_TypeDef *adc)
00988 {
00989   /* Stop conversions, before resetting other registers. */
00990   adc->CMD         = ADC_CMD_SINGLESTOP | ADC_CMD_SCANSTOP;
00991   adc->SINGLECTRL  = _ADC_SINGLECTRL_RESETVALUE;
00992 #if defined( _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_MASK )
00993   adc->SINGLECTRLX = _ADC_SINGLECTRLX_RESETVALUE;
00994 #endif
00995   adc->SCANCTRL    = _ADC_SCANCTRL_RESETVALUE;
00996 #if defined( _ADC_SCANCTRLX_MASK )
00997   adc->SCANCTRLX   = _ADC_SCANCTRLX_RESETVALUE;
00998 #endif
00999   adc->CTRL        = _ADC_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
01000   adc->IEN         = _ADC_IEN_RESETVALUE;
01001   adc->IFC         = _ADC_IFC_MASK;
01002   adc->BIASPROG    = _ADC_BIASPROG_RESETVALUE;
01003 #if defined( _ADC_SCANMASK_MASK )
01004   adc->SCANMASK    = _ADC_SCANMASK_RESETVALUE;
01005 #endif
01006 #if defined( _ADC_SCANCHCONF_MASK )
01007   adc->SCANCHCONF  = _ADC_SCANCHCONF_RESETVALUE;
01008 #endif
01009 #if defined( _ADC_SCANNSEL_MASK )
01010   adc->SCANNSEL    = _ADC_SCANNSEL_RESETVALUE;
01011 #endif
01012 
01013   /* Clear data FIFOs */
01014 #if defined( _ADC_SINGLEFIFOCLEAR_MASK )
01015   adc->SINGLEFIFOCLEAR |= ADC_SINGLEFIFOCLEAR_SINGLEFIFOCLEAR;
01016   adc->SCANFIFOCLEAR |= ADC_SCANFIFOCLEAR_SCANFIFOCLEAR;
01017 #endif
01018 
01019   /* Load calibration values for the 1V25 internal reference. */
01020   ADC_LoadDevinfoCal(adc, adcRef1V25, _ADC_CAL_SINGLEOFFSET_SHIFT);
01021   ADC_LoadDevinfoCal(adc, adcRef1V25, _ADC_CAL_SCANOFFSET_SHIFT);
01022 
01023 #if defined( _ADC_SCANCHCONF_MASK )
01024   /* Do not reset route register, setting should be done independently */
01025 #endif
01026 }
01027 
01028 
01029 /***************************************************************************/
01039 uint8_t ADC_TimebaseCalc(uint32_t hfperFreq)
01040 {
01041   if (!hfperFreq)
01042   {
01043     hfperFreq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_HFPER);
01044 
01045     /* Just in case, make sure we get non-zero freq for below calculation */
01046     if (!hfperFreq)
01047     {
01048       hfperFreq = 1;
01049     }
01050   }
01051 #if defined( _EFM32_GIANT_FAMILY ) || defined( _EFM32_WONDER_FAMILY )
01052   /* Handle errata on Giant Gecko, max TIMEBASE is 5 bits wide or max 0x1F */
01053   /* cycles. This will give a warmp up time of e.g. 0.645us, not the       */
01054   /* required 1us when operating at 48MHz. One must also increase acqTime  */
01055   /* to compensate for the missing clock cycles, adding up to 1us in total.*/
01056   /* See reference manual for details. */
01057   if ( hfperFreq > 32000000 )
01058   {
01059     hfperFreq = 32000000;
01060   }
01061 #endif
01062   /* Determine number of HFPERCLK cycle >= 1us */
01063   hfperFreq += 999999;
01064   hfperFreq /= 1000000;
01065 
01066   /* Return timebase value (N+1 format) */
01067   return (uint8_t)(hfperFreq - 1);
01068 }
01069 
01070 
01073 #endif /* defined(ADC_COUNT) && (ADC_COUNT > 0) */
